titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 6304) to amend the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978 to establish a procedure for authorizing certain acquisitions of foreign intelligence, and for other purposes.

Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 6304) to amend the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978 to establish a procedure for authorizing certain acquisitions of foreign intelligence, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-721, by Mr. Arcuri.
All points of order against consideration of the bill are waived except those arising under clause 9 or 10 of rule XXI.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 240.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1285.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 6304) to amend the Foreign Intelligence Surveillance Act of 1978 to establish a procedure for authorizing certain acquisitions of foreign intelligence.
